question: Choose the sentence with the best use of the subjunctive mood:
options: If I was you, I would study harder.
If I were you, I would study harder.
If I am you, I would study harder.
If I be you, I would study harder.

question: Select the correct sentence using the correct form of the verb 'to lie' (recline):
options: Yesterday, I lay down for a nap.
Yesterday, I lied down for a nap.
Yesterday, I lain down for a nap.
Yesterday, I lying down for a nap.

question: Which sentence uses the passive voice correctly?
options: The cake was eaten by him yesterday.
The cake was ate by him yesterday.
The cake were eaten by him yesterday.
The cake is ate by him yesterday.

question: Identify the correct conditional sentence type 3:
options: If she will have studied, she would pass.
If she had studied, she would have passed.
If she studied, she would have passed.
If she studies, she would have passed.

question: Pick the sentence that correctly uses a non-defining relative clause:
options: My brother, who lives in Japan, is visiting us next week.
The man who is wearing a hat is my father.
The book which I borrowed is interesting.
The girl who studies hard is my sister.

question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of the modal verb expressing obligation in the past:
options: You must to finish the report yesterday.
You had to finish the report yesterday.
You must finished the report yesterday.
You must finishing the report yesterday.

question: Select the correct sentence with subject-verb agreement:
options: Neither the teacher nor the students was ready.
Neither the teacher nor the students were ready.
Neither the teacher or the students were ready.
Neither the teacher or the students was ready.

question: Choose the sentence with correct usage of reported speech (past tense):
options: He said that he is tired.
He said that he was tired.
He said that he will be tired.
He said that he has been tired.

question: Which sentence correctly uses the future perfect tense?
options: By next year, I will finished college.
By next year, I will have finished college.
By next year, I will be finishing college.
By next year, I will finish college.

question: Choose the sentence with correct use of 'used to':
options: I used to going to the gym every day.
I use to go to the gym every day.
I used to go to the gym every day.
I used to went to the gym every day.

question: Identify the sentence with correct placement of adverbs:
options: She always has been late to meetings.
She has always been late to meetings.
She has been always late to meetings.
She has been late always to meetings.

question: Pick the sentence that correctly uses the past perfect continuous tense:
options: I had been working all night before the meeting.
I have been working all night before the meeting.
I was working all night before the meeting.
I had worked all night before the meeting.

question: Choose the sentence with correct use of countable and uncountable nouns:
options: She has many informations about the topic.
She has much information about the topic.
She has many information about the topic.
She has much informations about the topic.

question: Which sentence uses a correct comparative structure?
options: This is more better than the other option.
This is better than the other option.
This is best than the other option.
This is more best than the other option.

question: Select the sentence that uses an infinitive correctly:
Pick the sentence with correct plural form:
Choose the sentence that correctly uses 'either...or':
options: Either John or his friends is coming to the party.
Either John or his friends are coming to the party.
Either John or his friends am coming to the party.
Either John or his friends be coming to the party.

question: Identify the sentence with correct use of 'wish' for a present regret:
options: I wish I knew the answer now.
I wish I know the answer now.
I wish I will know the answer now.
I wish I would know the answer now.

question: Pick the sentence with correct use of gerunds:
options: She enjoys to swim in the ocean.
She enjoys swimming in the ocean.
She enjoys swim in the ocean.

question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses 'although':
options: Although he was tired, he went to the gym.
Although he was tired but he went to the gym.
Although he was tired so he went to the gym.
Although he was tired and he went to the gym.

Which word is closest in meaning to 'obsolete'?
Pick the word that best fits in this sentence: 'He gave a __________ explanation that everyone understood.'
Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'She has a strong __________ for learning new languages.'
Select the word that doesn’t belong in the group:
Which of the following means 'to delay or postpone'?
Choose the word that best completes the sentence: 'The weather was __________, so the picnic was cancelled.'

Which word fits best? 'The artist’s work was __________, admired by critics and fans alike.'
Choose the best synonym for 'reluctant':

Which word is an antonym of 'transparent'?
Choose the word that best fits: 'He made a __________ decision that surprised everyone.'

Which word fits? 'The new policy will __________ the efficiency of the company.'
